Interface GameFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
SameGameFactory, SokobanFactory
public interface GameFactory
Defines a factory for creating the core components of a game. Each specific game (e.g., SameGame, 2048) will implement this interface to provide instances of its concrete model, views, and controller. This pattern decouples the game setup logic from the main application launcher.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    AbstractGameController
    createController()
    Creates and returns an instance of the game's specific AbstractGameController.
    InputStrategy
    createInputStrategy()
    Creates and returns an instance of the default InputStrategy for the game.
    AbstractGameModel
    createModel()
    Creates and returns an instance of the game's specific AbstractGameModel.
    List<GameView>
    createViews(AbstractGameModel model)
    Creates and returns a list of GameViews for the game.
    default AbstractGameController
    setupGame()
    A convenience method to assemble a fully configured game.

  • Method Details

    • createModel

      AbstractGameModel createModel()
      Creates and returns an instance of the game's specific AbstractGameModel.
      Returns:
      A new game model instance.

    • createViews

      List<GameView> createViews(AbstractGameModel model)
      Creates and returns a list of GameViews for the game. A game might have multiple views (e.g., a GUI view and a console view).
      Parameters:
      model - The game model that the views will observe.
      Returns:
      A list of new game view instances.

    • createController

      AbstractGameController createController()
      Creates and returns an instance of the game's specific AbstractGameController.
      Returns:
      A new game controller instance.

    • createInputStrategy

      InputStrategy createInputStrategy()
      Creates and returns an instance of the default InputStrategy for the game.
      Returns:
      A new input strategy instance.

    • setupGame

      default AbstractGameController setupGame()
      A convenience method to assemble a fully configured game. It typically creates the model, views, input strategy, and controller, and wires them together.
      Returns:
      A configured AbstractGameController ready to start the game.
